intro: Hieracium niphogeton, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium niphogeton is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
